tags: like the line between arya and mercy is esp distinct and i love that
summary: the many facets of arya’s identities  arya underfoot: a friend   arya horseface: an outsider  arry: an orphan boy  weasel: a...
body:
the many facets of arya’s identities 

  • arya underfoot: a friend 
  • arya horseface: an outsider
  • arry: an orphan boy
  • weasel: a baby girl
  • nan: a storyteller, an old woman
  • nymeria: a wolf, a warrior queen
  • squab: a bird
  • salty: a stowaway 
  • cat: a mother, a feline 
  • blind beth: a childhood peer 
  • the ugly girl: an abused child
  • mercy: a silly actress 

and there will be more yet. her complexity knows no bounds! and its amazing to me because none of them diminish arya’s true character. they only make it stronger.

blog.name: ladystarks
blog.title: lo, the transforming power of love

summary: uuhhh question how do you think the starks are going to react to theon visiting winterfell and to his bond (idk how else to...
question: uuhhh question how do you think the starks are going to react to theon visiting winterfell and to his bond (idk how else to describe it) with sansa? (if he does visit wf bc i honestly wouldn’t be surprised if d&d just completely forgot about theon’s whole greyjoy/stark struggle and the theon/sansa dynamic also)
answer:
Ohhh I would really love a Theon/Sansa reunion scene!!! Now I’m actually looking forward to something in season 8!

I think that Jon already knows about their bond, and wouldn’t be surprised, but Arya would be angry at Theon at first for betraying Robb, and wouldn’t understand how Sansa could forgive him. I think Theon will do something that makes her understand, though.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: maisiestyle
blog.title: Maisie Williams | Arya Stark | Styles & Musings

summary:
Arya & Jon’s Reunion according to some Jon/Sansa fans


 Admitting right off the bat, most Jonsa followers, according to...
caption:
Arya & Jon’s Reunion according to some Jon/Sansa fans

Admitting right off the bat, most Jonsa followers, according to @fortunatelylori think Arya and Jon will have problems and a reunion that is fraught with unease and distrust. Like, why? But then again, we all *know* why.👀

This belies one clear fact: Arya truly trusts Jon and she will judge Dany for herself. Some of you guys really give Arya very little credit in this regard. I think we will see a much closer bond with these two in S8 with Maisie fondly describing Jon/Arya’s friendship in a recent interview recapping the whole series that was released last week.

This fact is increased evermore so with the news from Maisie that her S8 storyline will be reminiscent of her S1 storyline where we first saw her bond with Jon highlighted so beautifully. S1 also had no Kill List or Faceless Men arcs so we should be prepared to see those elements in her story fall away and no longer matter as much to her.

After reading the scripts, in a Jan 2018 interview, Maisie said her greatest hope for Arya is to see her let go of her anger and quest for vengeance and find peace. She later said she got to do everything she wanted to do for Arya in S8 and exhausted every aspect of her character. Maisie had to rewatch S1 and she plotted out the beginning, middle and end of Arya’s S8 storyline – so it seems she has much to do! Maisie admitted as much when she was on Jimmy Kimmel and then again in her more recent Guardian interview saying she had more to do in S8 than any prior season of Game of Thrones. That’s very telling!

Plus, the more keen observers who noted how closely inline Kit and Maisie’s filming schedules were this year, with those two filming the most consistently since Nov 2017 to July 2018, wouldn’t be surprised if Arya/Jon have an even stronger bond than *some* people are dreading. According to WoTW new article:  

“They spent 10 months filming six episodes of television, which would normally take about two months. That’s pretty crazy. And a lot of that wasn’t the big battle stuff, but the regular scenes of two people talking in a hallway,” he clarifies". - James Hibberd, Entertainment Weekly writer. He visited the S8 set twice during filming. According to his IG, he was on the S8 set in Belfast: Moneyglass location (The huge Winterfell set) early March. He also saw a very important E6 scene being filmed and he was shocked at who was still there by the end of the season. I’ll talk more about this in a new post!

Arya avenged the Red Wedding in S6/S7 and I think she would take the threat of the NK and the Army of the Dead far more seriously right now (over some politics) and understand where Jon is coming from. Not once have the writers ever shown Arya doubt Jon leading up to their long awaited reunion. If that was their plan, in S7 at least, the writers would have introduced some hint of Arya questioning Jon’s motives or even have her see Sansa’s POV with some merit. Arya has never done that and I doubt she’ll start in S8. In fact, the opposite has happened with Arya *supporting* Jon while the rest of the Lords/Sansa continued to doubt him.

Sansa knows for a fact (as all the viewers do) that Arya would always choose Jon.

blog.name: buttercuparry
blog.title: Warm Winter Sun
blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

summary: Maybe I should go to the Wall instead of Riverrun. Jon wouldn't care who I killed or whether I brushed my hair . . .
body:
Maybe I should go to the Wall instead of Riverrun. Jon wouldn’t care who I killed or whether I brushed my hair …

Friendly reminder that Jon would never turn away his little sister. Jon knows what it is like to be in tough situations. Jon knows what it is like to be cornered and Jon knows that sometimes you have to make tough choices to get out of these said situations. Idk why but some people have this very chivalrous image of Jon in their mind…but the thing is Jon is not some knight from a song. He too had to make a number of tough choices as the Lord Commander and I am pretty sure that those choices can’t completely be categorised as black or white. Also if we talk about the TV series then why is Jon hanging his brother’s of the NW ( the ones who betrayed him of course), not seen as psychotic but Arya having a list and killing those who deserved it is seen as such? Nobody even acknowledges that she never harms the innocent. Is it wrong for her to be angry? To want revenge? Also the thing is Arya does abandon her plan of going south and confronting Cersei in favor of going north to reunite with Jon…why is this not mentioned?

blog.name: thefeatherofhope
blog.title: Littlefeather
blog.description:
It's about what you believe. 
And I believe in love 💗

summary: I’ve killed a lot more than him, I promise you. You think that makes me some monster. Well, maybe it does, but I saved your...
body:
I’ve killed a lot more than him, I promise you. You think that makes me some monster. Well, maybe it does, but I saved your sister’s life too. The day the mob pulled her off her horse, I cut through them and brought her back to the castle, else she would have gotten what Lollys Stokeworth got. And she sang for me. You didn’t know that, did you? Your sister sang me a sweet little song.

A Storm of Swords, Arya IX

blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: a post of ice and fire
summary: I watched the promo with Maisie, Sophie and Kit and I thought of an alternative reality where the Stark kids make a promo video...
body:
I watched the promo with Maisie, Sophie and Kit and I thought of an alternative reality where the Stark kids make a promo video for their House.

On that video, Maisie and Sophie include themselves as to what game of thrones has to offer. But it’s Sophie who also mentions Kit, instead of doing it himself. And I can imagine either of Stark sisters (or even better both) to be the ones to include Jon as to what House Stark has to offer (because Jon is too humble and insecure to associate himself with the Stark name).

Bonus, in the House Stark video Bran also participates and since he knows the future of each Stark sibling he mentions towards the end of this promo and then the rest of his siblings look at him with a “wtf” face because he spoiled the future in front of everyone.

summary:
jon: directly uses his heart to describe arya multiple times
arya: literally thinks only jon would want her
sansa, on got: “arya...
body:
jon: directly uses his heart to describe arya multiple times

arya: literally thinks only jon would want her

sansa, on got: “arya always loved jon best” // “jon’s heart will probably stop when he sees arya”

some fuckery fans: jon will not accept his little sister, that little psycho, they will obviously be antagonized, their reunion will be nothing near jon and sansa’s

summary:
Sansa: Dad, she said the b word! 
Ned: Is that true?
Arya: Motherfucker doesn't start with a b.

blog.name: fortunatelylori
blog.title: Thoughts on the verge
blog.description:
Pretty much Game of Throne and Jonsa all day, every day. 
Avatar and header by @ragekitn

summary: If pol!Jon isn’t true, do you think Arya will be okay with Jon bending the knee to Dany? Especially if he really did just bend...
question: If pol!Jon isn’t true, do you think Arya will be okay with Jon bending the knee to Dany? Especially if he really did just bend it impulsively because he was so ~overcome~ with his love for her? A L S O, do you think Arya will steal another face in season 8, and, if so, whose? :)
answer:
Hey, nonnie!

You know this is a very interesting question because we, in the Jonsa fandom, have been debating for a while just how Jon and Arya’s relationship will develop in season 8 and I know it’s a sore point for many Arya fans that Jonsas think Arya and Jon’s reunion will not go as smoothly as people imagine. 

But I’d like to put this in context a little so people don’t misinterpret what I’m saying. Arya, out of all the Stark children, was the one that was exposed the most to the devastation of the War of the Five Kings. That’s not to say the others didn’t endure harrowing experiences. All of them have been through hell and this is not a competition of who suffered most. But by virtue of either being in King’s Landing, at the Wall or beyond the Wall, Sansa, Jon and Bran have been isolated from Robb’s rebellion or what that meant for the 7 kingdoms as a whole. 

Arya was in the midst of it. Since her father’s death until she ultimately decides to go to Braavos, Arya has been trying to get back home, to Winterfell. She is the only one out of all of them to witness the Red Wedding. She was there and watched as Robb’s men were killed, saw his direwolf being slaughtered and had to stand by while the Freys sowed Grey Wind’s head onto Robb’s body and paraded it around. To say that she would now be A-OK with Jon bending the knee to a stranger with dragons and a gang of violent savages and essentially giving up his ancestral home (one she’s been struggling to get back to since s1) and the North that her oldest brother died fighting for, is both ignoring her experiences as well as insulting her intelligence. So no, I don’t think Arya would be OK with Jon doing that. She loves Jon very, very much and, of course, she wants him to be happy but one thing doesn’t excuse the other. 

Now, as for how it will play out, I tend to go back and forth between 2 scenarios: 

1. Arya will simply reject what Jon has done and become antagonistic towards him from the start - this is mainly based on her impulsive nature. I don’t think this is very likely because, like I said, she loves him very much and while she’s been traumatized and has become “a bit of a monster” (Maisie’s words), I don’t think she’d ever threaten to cut off Jon’s face as she did with Sansa. It pains me to say it but I don’t think showArya, at least, loves showSansa that much (or vice versa to be honest). They’ve reach a point of comfort at the end of s7 and I hope their relationship develops positively in s8 but, at this point, it is what it is. Jon is different because, out of all of her family, Arya loves him the most. He’s the only reason why she even gave up her list and came back to Winterfell. Which brings me to the 2nd scenario …

2. Arya will try to understand Jon’s reasoning for doing what he did but ultimately won’t be able to which will cause a rift between the two of them. I don’t think there’s any scenario in which Arya will warm up to D*ny, no matter how pretty or how cool she looks atop her dragons. D*ny is a threat to Winterfell and the pack and I doubt Arya would be happy to stand by and let her take away what the Starks have died and bled for. I think she’d ultimately think Jon stupid for doing what he did. 

This is one of the many reasons, btw, why I’m so invested in pol!Jon. Aside from the narrative and thematic importance of Jon not committing the mistakes of the other Starks that went South, in the absence of a political motivation, Jon is putting at risk all of the most important relationships in his life: his relationship with Arya, his relationship with Sansa, his relationship with the North that he calls home and where he was finally accepted after feeling rejected all his life. I really don’t want him to lose all of that just so he can have subpar s*x with the dragon lady. 

As for your other question, yes, I do think Arya will steal another face in season 8. I don’t think her Faceless Men arc is over. To me, the FM are the Hotel California of Game of Thrones: “You can check out anytime you want but you can never leave”. So she will be drawn back into it and she will end up killing someone and taking their face. 

As for whom … That’s more difficult to answer because, aside from Walder Frey, we haven’t seen Arya steal a face of any importance. I would imagine that it would have to be someone from her list because as much as she might want to give it up at some point (my head canon is that Jon will try to steer her away from the list because he won’t be able to bare seeing his little sister become a psychopathic murderer), she will find herself in the position where she won’t be able to resist, for whatever reason. If I were to pick it would probably be the Hound. She refused to kill him once, she might have to go through with it in the end even if she doesn’t want to, which would be a nice twist on the idea of revenge and her list.
